stream_context.summary: Kaze continues building the Cowboy/Saloon level.  He finishes importing most geometry, fixes shading on Shy Guys, experiments with textures, and designs the secret saloon back-room that leads to a mine-cart chase sequence.  He also showcases new dialogue cut-scenes and discusses camera, physics and performance tweaks.

development_findings.summary: A generic “net physics” function was written, letting Kaze add climbable net objects anywhere with minimal code changes.
development_findings.quote: I wrote a generic function for this now, so this is super easy to add to anything.

development_findings.summary: Shy Guy models were tweaked because an environment-color combiner made them appear too dark.
development_findings.quote: I changed the Shy Guys a little bit… I had to change a bunch of combiners because they all had environment color and it made everything look very dark.

development_findings.summary: Kaze is building a new flame model that uses particle effects; it is still a work-in-progress.
development_findings.quote: Oh, I was working on a new flame model that had some particle effect. It's very much in progress.

development_findings.summary: New dialogue cut-scene system was added, allowing cinematic camera moves during conversations.
development_findings.quote: We have new dialogue cutscenes… I should add that to my in-case clips list.

development_findings.summary: He is debating replacing the current ‘hold-L for over-the-shoulder’ view with a full first-person camera for consistency with the Yoshi-hook mechanic.
development_findings.quote: I'm still considering just going full first-person… we already have a full first-person thing for when you have the Yoshi hook.

development_findings.summary: Room-system algorithm was recently optimized to skip actor processing more efficiently, reducing lag.
development_findings.quote: I actually improved that algorithm recently. It's a lot better now. I think a bit of lag is gone from that.

development_findings.summary: The saloon’s secret room will trigger a mine-cart chase: three rails, six mine-carts, Snifits shoot large iron balls at Mario, and falling onto the rails kills the player (fade-out).  End platform may collapse into a lower cave where the encounter concludes.
development_findings.quote: We're going to have three minecarts and like three rails… If you land on the rails, you're just going to die… at the end there's a fight after the track.

development_findings.summary: To handle curved tracks, Kaze will attach invisible dynamic walls to the cart or use splines so the carts stay on rails.
development_findings.quote: There's a dynamic object that is only solid while you are in the minecart… We may need to make splines to follow along.

development_findings.summary: Using 8 MB memory allows simple segmentation and gives about a 3-5 % speed boost compared with 4 MB.
development_findings.quote: The extra 4 MB lets you do memory segmenting a little bit, which is like a 3-5 % speedup.

development_findings.summary: libdragon is considered too slow for the project, but specific features might be ported into Kaze’s custom engine.
development_findings.quote: libdragon performs very poorly right now, so I definitely do not want to port it… but there are a few libdragon features that I might port into Orgy.ai.

context_findings.summary: Kaze prefers minimal spending and disdains expensive status items, linking that attitude to personal values.
context_findings.quote: I don't value having expensive stuff at all… when I see people wearing expensive things I think of Elliot Rodger.

context_findings.summary: He intends to release the game free and open-source; monetization, if any, will be limited to a physical OST cartridge with box and manual.
context_findings.quote: I think video games should not be monetized off of video game sales… I might sell a version that is just the OST cartridge.

context_findings.summary: Over 70 of his YouTube videos have been taken down by Nintendo, which shapes his release/marketing approach.
context_findings.quote: Usually when a video gets too popular they just take it down. My channel would be a lot more blown up if it wasn't for Nintendo trying to sabotage me.

context_findings.summary: Personal note: his girlfriend’s mother was taken to hospital; he briefly calls it depressing.
context_findings.quote: Since last stream, my girlfriend's mom had to go to the hospital… that's fucking depressing.

context_findings.summary: He sees open-sourcing both engine and game as non-negotiable.
context_findings.quote: Yes, everything will be open source. I can't open source the game without open sourcing the engine.

biobak.summary: Provided real-time feedback on shading, textures, and proposed comedic dialogue (‘milky way’ bounty pun) for an easter-egg NPC.
biobak.quote: One NPC should mention… 'We do things the milky way here'.

zeina.summary: Was supposed to deliver milk-bottle models for the saloon sequence but has not yet done so.
zeina.quote: We still need a bunch of milk bottles and stuff and Zeina said she wanted to give those to us, but I guess she forgot.

key_stories.title: Designing the Saloon’s Secret Mine-Cart Chase
key_stories.summary: While importing the cowboy saloon, Kaze conceives a hidden back-room where outlaw Shy Guys drink illicit chocolate milk.  He brainstorms a chase involving multiple mine-carts, projectile-shooting Snifits, and a collapsing endpoint, wrestling with gameplay clarity and technical constraints.
key_stories.challenge: Create a fresh, engaging star mission that feels distinct from existing ‘kill X enemies’ objectives and works within N64 limitations.
key_stories.process: Iterated live: discussed camera, number of carts, rail curves, player death conditions, dynamic walls versus spline paths, and possible collapse cut-scene.
key_stories.outcome: Settled on two rows of three mine-carts, jump-based platforming, Snifit projectiles, instant death on rails, and a brief fight or cut-scene at the end. Implementation deferred to a future session.
key_stories.key_quote: We're going to have three minecarts and like three rails… If you land on the rails, you're just going to die… at the end there's a fight after the track.

key_stories.title: Net Physics Made Modular
key_stories.summary: Kaze converts bespoke net-climb code into a generic function, enabling easy reuse across levels.
key_stories.challenge: Previous net objects required custom code each time.
key_stories.process: Abstracted behaviour into a single function and tested on saloon’s hanging net.
key_stories.outcome: Feature now drag-and-drop; speeds future level assembly.
key_stories.key_quote: I wrote a generic function for this now, so this is super easy to add to anything.

key_stories.title: Nintendo Takedowns Shape Release Philosophy
key_stories.summary: Having over 70 videos removed, Kaze doubles down on free, open-source distribution and minimal monetization.
key_stories.challenge: Consistent DMCA pressure from Nintendo reduces channel growth and revenue.
key_stories.process: Reflects on alternatives: no game sales, only optional OST cartridge.
key_stories.outcome: Commitment to open-source project and non-commercial release.
key_stories.key_quote: My channel would be a lot more blown up if it wasn't for Nintendo trying to sabotage me.
